page.title: 20North Mymms Park
page.content: {North Mymms Park}is a private estate near{Colney Heath.The house is a red {Manor house}built in the 16th century but it has been an estate since 1066. Members of the royal family have stayed there. In the house there are a large number of rooms some of which have decorated ceilings. {There is a Clock Tower on the North {Side of North Mymms Park.}The inside of the Clock tower was built in 1801. The house was badly in need of repair. Some men are working to restore it to its original condition.{An Arabian man {owns the house now.}He is planning to open part of it to the public.The gardens were set out in squares by William Robinson.They are open once a year for the Red Cross fete.
